required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Center, Prospective Pilot Study to Verify the Algorithm of mCVI® to Accurately Capture Pulse Rate and Respiratory Rate in 10 Healthy Subjects in Comparison to Commercially-Available Masimo Pulse Oximeter Devices

brief_summary.textblock: This single center pilot study is to verify the algorithm of mCVI® to accurately capture pulse rate and respiratory rate in 10 healthy subjects in comparison to commercially-available Masimo pulse oximeter devices. This is a non significant risk device.

detailed_description.textblock: In this pilot study the mCVI device is a mobile application used to simply verify the algorithm when the mobile video reads a patients pulse rate and respiratory rate while spontaneously breathing. There is no facial recognition technology. There is no immediate feedback given to the research team to act upon or provide for further clinical care decisions. In real time, the mCVI device will be compared to two commercially available pulse oximeter devices in a single visit.

primary_outcome.description: To verify whether the mCVI® accurately captures pulse rate and respiratory rate.

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate whether the mCVI accurately captures pulse rate and respiratory rate with patients with different skin types.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adult patients between the ages of 21 - 70
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical conditions that could compromise a patient's ability to provide for all breathing samples or follow instructions
- Medications that could compromise a patient's ability to participate in the study
- Documented medical history of respiratory or cardiovascular disease
- Excessive facial hair, facial deformities, or obstructions that could compromise the recording of pulse rate and respiratory rate of the mCVI®
- Missing digits or fingers on one or more hand that would prevent proper recording of Masimo pulse oximeter devices
- Recent (≤ 1 month) surgical procedure of any kind
- Current participation in another investigational clinical trial
- Inability to provide informed consent
